brief_title: Remote Audiometry to Monitor for Treatment-Related Hearing Loss in Patients With H&N SCC Receiving Cisplatin and/or Radiation
cancer_type_display: A study monitoring treatment-related hearing loss for patients with various types of head and neck squamous cell carcinoma who are receiving cisplatin and/or radiation therapy.

site_name: Emory Midtown University Hospital/Winship Cancer Institute

locations.facility: Emory Midtown University Hospital/Winship Cancer Institute

key_inclusion_summary: Must have pathologically proven head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC).
Patients can have previously untreated or recurrent/metastatic disease.
Will be treated with cisplatin chemotherapy and/or radiation.
Life expectancy of more than 3 months.
key_exclusion_summary: Patients with profound hearing loss in both ears, which precludes an accurate hearing test.
Patients who are unable to participate in a hearing test as per the investigator's judgment.
